solution_line_template: The third dig site was dated from the year {fourth_site_date_bc} / {twice_as_old_divisor} = <<{fourth_site_date_bc}/{twice_as_old_divisor}={third_site_date_bc}>>{third_site_date_bc} BC.
Thus, the first dig site was dated from the year {third_site_date_bc} - {older_than_first_site} = <<{third_site_date_bc}-{older_than_first_site}={first_site_date_bc}>>{first_site_date_bc} BC.

The second dig site was {more_recent_than_second_site} years older, so it was dated from the year {first_site_date_bc} + {more_recent_than_second_site} = <<{first_site_date_bc}+{more_recent_than_second_site}={second_site_date_bc}>>{second_site_date_bc} BC.
